Entry.1:
Le Havre

I have been in this aust Depot a week now and things are going along fine. This Camp has just opened. I have come here with a 
Spt
Septic Hand hope to be Back with my Soon

26th 5/18

wrote To Les

hope to hear from him Shortly

G McClintock

6/1/18

Neippe 

Things quiet today.

We go into the line Tuesday for 8 day Stunt then to Boulogne for 2 months
Entry.2: was up to morning was marked active go into the this Evening.

hand Doing fine

Entry.5:
Things are Jolly in the . its Name is Coulomby and is some 32 Kilos from Boulogne we are Billited in an Estaminet

Madam is this owner Shop we are the 

of our lives here things are 

McClintock
Entry.6:
L. Havre

went out to the School this morning The usual rot we have to go through am Expecting to go on Draft tomorrow or monday all well in Les allright So far

G McClintock
Entry.7:
Play 

letters from him since he joined Army BtnI am at present on guard over prisoners. This is the first Guard that I have Done since the Gallipoli affair Camon at 3-30 yesterday have Done 6 hours So far have 2 more to Do then I am finished until 3-30 this Evening When we get roll on 3-30

G McClintock

poisoned Hand

28th.5 18

Le Treport Hopsital 47th 

 perhaps my Luck Will Change Some time in 1955

another Evacuation left this at 4 this Evening for England the Lucky chaps they are to get there this is my 7th time a Casualty in this war and not once
Entry.22:
L Havre 

received 60 francs pay today this making Eighty this week. Still have 50 left.

have not had letters from Ireland for Some time (GMC)

 Hospital with trench fever arrived in England Lucky Beggar. hope to leave here some time tomorrow to join my Btn 

(GMC)

Madamselle Mare Cailleux

Entry.24:
Le Treport

I Came into this Hospital Some 5 Days ago Every thing here is ok food is wrote to this hope to get to Blighty from this Hospital this is the 47th Gen Hospital
Entry.26:
prisoners in the Compound

 passed through here today theEscaped from

Le Treport

Entry.28:
Birthday and it was Spent in Hospital with a Septic right hand Perhaps next one shall be in Australia who Knows according To Day rumour

we haveDriven the Huns

according To Day rumour 

We have Driven the Huns Back again This is good News for us Troops things are quiet here today I Went to a picture show this Eve in the Y.M.C.A it was simply up to Putty

McClintock
Entry.29:
-1918

Things are going along Smoothly Just now at the present time we are out of the line with the
Entry.30:
Brigade While the main Body are in the front line We are Camped on the Banks of the just outside Amiens and is an Ideal Camping Ground under very tall Trees plenty of swimming & Boating on this Bonnie little stream. Went to field ambulance this morning for Drugs.

Les still doing well in

Les still doing well & is attached to with me.

G McClintock

have not had any letters from Australia for Some months. But Don't Say Die.
